text:
e="preserve">Renée Claude (July 3, 1939 – May 12, 2020) was a Canadian actress and pop singer. She was born in Montreal, Quebec. She was best known for singing translated songs by Stéphane Venne, Michel Conte, Georges Brassens and Léo Ferré. An actress, she starred in "It's Your Turn, Laura Cadieux", "Avec un grand A" and in "He Shoots, He Scores".
In 2019, Claude was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. She died of COVID-19 in Montreal on May 12, 2020 at the age of 80.
